message:
I'm trying to install ruby 2.1.2 using rbenv, I downloaded rbenv, got the plugin "ruby-build" but got this error message when trying to run the "rbenv install 2.1.2" command:

Downloading ruby-2.1.2.tar.gz...
-> http://dqw8nmjcqpjn7.cloudfront.net/f22a6447811a81f3c808d1c2a5ce3b5f5f0955c68c9a749182feb425589e6635
Installing ruby-2.1.2...
 
BUILD FAILED

Inspect or clean up the working tree at /tmp/ruby-build.20140630184115.11627
Results logged to /tmp/ruby-build.20140630184115.11627.log

Last 10 log lines:
                              io-console 0.4.2
                              json 1.8.1
                              minitest 4.7.5
                              psych 2.0.5
                              rake 10.1.0
                              rdoc 4.1.0
                              test-unit 2.1.2.0
installing rdoc:              /home/taz/.rbenv/versions/2.1.2/share/ri/2.1.0/system
installing capi-docs:         /home/taz/.rbenv/versions/2.1.2/share/doc/ruby
The Ruby openssl extension was not compiled. Missing the OpenSSL lib?

any help on how to fix that?
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: I'm using elementary os which is based on ubuntu

in a nutshell, just run this command:"
$ apt-get install libssl-dev
"
I posted this in case someone else runs into the same issue
